com.cyc.kb.spi

Interface SentenceService


  • public interface SentenceService
    Provides implementations of Sentence, including methods to build Sentences of Sentences.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Sentence and(Iterable<Sentence> sentences)
      Conjoin sentences.
      Sentence and(Sentence... sentences)
      Conjoin sentences.
      Sentence get(Object... args)
      Builds an arbitrary sentence based on the args provided.
      Sentence get(Relation pred, Object... args)
      Builds a sentence based on pred and other args.
      Sentence get(String sentStr)
      Attempts to convert a CycL string into a CycFormulaSentence and thus into a KbObject, Sentence.
      Sentence implies(Collection<Sentence> antecedent, Sentence consequent)
      Make a new conditional sentence with the specified antecedent and consequent.
      Sentence implies(Sentence antecedent, Sentence consequent)
      Make a new conditional sentence with the specified antecedent and consequent.
      Sentence or(Iterable<Sentence> sentences)
      Disjoin sentences.
      Sentence or(Sentence... sentences)
      Disjoin sentences.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Sentence get(String sentStr)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Attempts to convert a CycL string into a CycFormulaSentence and thus into a KbObject, Sentence.

        Parameters:
        sentStr - the string representing a Sentence in the KB, a CycL sentence
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException - if the Sentence represented by sentStr could not be parsed.

      • get

        Sentence get(Relation pred,
             Object... args)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Builds a sentence based on pred and other args. Note that args should be KbObjects, Strings, Numbers, or Dates. This constructor also handles Lists and Sets (and Lists of Lits or Sets of Lists, etc.) of those supported objects.
        Parameters:
        pred - the first argument of the formula
        args - the other arguments of the formula in the order they appear in the list
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - is thrown if the built cycObject is not a instance of CycFormulaSentence. This should never happen.
        CreateException

      • get

        Sentence get(Object... args)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Builds an arbitrary sentence based on the args provided. Note that args should either be KbObjects or Java classes, String, Number or Date. This constructor also handles java.util.List and java.util.Set of other supported KB API or Java objects. It even supports, List of List etc.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments of the formula in order
        Returns:
        a Sentence object
        Throws:
        KbTypeException - never thrown
        CreateException

      • and

        Sentence and(Sentence... sentences)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Conjoin sentences. Creates a list and calls and(java.lang.Iterable)
        Parameters:
        sentences - list of sentences to be conjoined
        Returns:
        a new conjoined sentence
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • and

        Sentence and(Iterable<Sentence> sentences)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Conjoin sentences. Creates a new sentence with #$and as the relation and all other sentences as the arguments.
        Parameters:
        sentences - list of sentences to be conjoined
        Returns:
        a new conjunction sentence
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

     throws KbTypeException,

        Disjoin sentences. Creates a list and calls or(java.lang.Iterable)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new disjunction sentence

        Parameters:

        Returns:
